entries.commitMessage: Initial project setup: types, questions, storage

answers.intent: Establish the type system and core data structures for git-reflect
answers.problemSolved: Needed clear TypeScript interfaces and utility functions for reflection storage
answers.learned: Using keyof with mapped types in TypeScript allows strongly typed data models
answers.wouldDoDifferently: Maybe started with tests first to drive the design
answers.testing: Unit tests for questions.ts and storage.ts modules
answers.technicalDebt: TODO: Add retry logic for corrupted log files

entries.commitMessage: Implement pre-commit hook with inquirer prompts

answers.intent: Create the interactive hook that prompts users for reflections before commit
answers.problemSolved: Pre-commit hook needs to gracefully handle async prompts and exit codes
answers.learned: Inquirer.js validation patterns are powerful for requiring non-empty answers
answers.wouldDoDifferently: Could have added a dry-run mode earlier for testing
answers.confidence: Medium-high - async error handling edge cases may exist
answers.testing: Manual testing with real git repos, integration test needed
answers.technicalDebt: TODO: Add support for multiple commits in one session without re-prompting

entries.commitMessage: Add ESLint, tests, and GitHub Actions CI workflow

answers.intent: Ensure code quality with linting, comprehensive tests, and automated CI
answers.problemSolved: Project needed automated testing and style checking before merges
answers.learned: Configuring ESLint v8 with TypeScript plugins requires careful dependency management
answers.wouldDoDifferently: Would have set up linting earlier in the project to catch issues sooner
answers.confidence: High - CI workflow is standard practice and well-tested
answers.testing: All 14 tests passing, linting clean, GitHub Actions configured for multiple Node versions
answers.technicalDebt: TODO: Add code coverage thresholds and enforce in CI
